00015     FMOD version number.  Check this against FMOD::System::getVersion.

00025 #if defined(__CYGWIN32__)

00027     #define F_STDCALL __stdcall
00028     #define F_DECLSPEC __declspec
00029     #define F_DLLEXPORT ( dllexport )
00030 #elif (defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(_WIN64) || defined(_XBOX))
00031     #define F_CDECL _cdecl
00032     #define F_STDCALL _stdcall
00033     #define F_DECLSPEC __declspec
00034     #define F_DLLEXPORT ( dllexport )
00035 #elif defined(__MACH__) || defined (__ANDROID__)
00036     #define F_CDECL
00037     #define F_STDCALL
00038     #define F_DECLSPEC
00039     #define F_DLLEXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility("default")))
00040 #else
00041     #define F_STDCALL
00042     #define F_CDECL
00043     #define F_DECLSPEC
00044     #define F_DLLEXPORT
00045 #endif

00049         #define F_API __attribute__ ((visibility("default")))
00050     #else
00051         #define F_API __declspec(dllexport) F_STDCALL
00052     #endif
00053 #else
00054     #define F_API F_STDCALL

00083 /*
00084 [ENUM]
00085 [
00086     [DESCRIPTION]   
00087     error codes.  Returned from every function.
00088 
00089     [REMARKS]
00090 
00091     [PLATFORMS]
00092     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00093 
00094     [SEE_ALSO]      
00095 ]
00096 */
00097 typedef enum
00098 {
00099     FMOD_OK,                        /* No errors. */
00100     FMOD_ERR_ALREADYLOCKED,         /* Tried to call lock a second time before unlock was called. */
00101     FMOD_ERR_BADCOMMAND,            /* Tried to call a function on a data type that does not allow this type of functionality (ie calling Sound::lock on a streaming sound). */
00102     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_DRIVERS,          /* Neither NTSCSI nor ASPI could be initialised. */
00103     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_INIT,             /* An error occurred while initialising the CDDA subsystem. */
00104     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_INVALID_DEVICE,   /* Couldn't find the specified device. */
00105     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_NOAUDIO,          /* No audio tracks on the specified disc. */
00106     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_NODEVICES,        /* No CD/DVD devices were found. */ 
00107     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_NODISC,           /* No disc present in the specified drive. */
00108     FMOD_ERR_CDDA_READ,             /* A CDDA read error occurred. */
00109     FMOD_ERR_CHANNEL_ALLOC,         /* Error trying to allocate a channel. */
00110     FMOD_ERR_CHANNEL_STOLEN,        /* The specified channel has been reused to play another sound. */
00111     FMOD_ERR_COM,                   /* A Win32 COM related error occured. COM failed to initialize or a QueryInterface failed meaning a Windows codec or driver was not installed properly. */
00112     FMOD_ERR_DMA,                   /* DMA Failure.  See debug output for more information. */
00113     FMOD_ERR_DSP_CONNECTION,        /* DSP connection error.  Connection possibly caused a cyclic dependancy.  Or tried to connect a tree too many units deep (more than 128). */
00114     FMOD_ERR_DSP_FORMAT,            /* DSP Format error.  A DSP unit may have attempted to connect to this network with the wrong format. */
00115     FMOD_ERR_DSP_NOTFOUND,          /* DSP connection error.  Couldn't find the DSP unit specified. */
00116     FMOD_ERR_DSP_RUNNING,           /* DSP error.  Cannot perform this operation while the network is in the middle of running.  This will most likely happen if a connection or disconnection is attempted in a DSP callback. */
00117     FMOD_ERR_DSP_TOOMANYCONNECTIONS,/* DSP connection error.  The unit being connected to or disconnected should only have 1 input or output. */
00118     FMOD_ERR_FILE_BAD,              /* Error loading file. */
00119     FMOD_ERR_FILE_COULDNOTSEEK,     /* Couldn't perform seek operation.  This is a limitation of the medium (ie netstreams) or the file format. */
00120     FMOD_ERR_FILE_DISKEJECTED,      /* Media was ejected while reading. */
00121     FMOD_ERR_FILE_EOF,              /* End of file unexpectedly reached while trying to read essential data (truncated data?). */
00122     FMOD_ERR_FILE_NOTFOUND,         /* File not found. */
00123     FMOD_ERR_FILE_UNWANTED,         /* Unwanted file access occured. */
00124     FMOD_ERR_FORMAT,                /* Unsupported file or audio format. */
00125     FMOD_ERR_HTTP,                  /* A HTTP error occurred. This is a catch-all for HTTP errors not listed elsewhere. */
00126     FMOD_ERR_HTTP_ACCESS,           /* The specified resource requires authentication or is forbidden. */
00127     FMOD_ERR_HTTP_PROXY_AUTH,       /* Proxy authentication is required to access the specified resource. */
00128     FMOD_ERR_HTTP_SERVER_ERROR,     /* A HTTP server error occurred. */
00129     FMOD_ERR_HTTP_TIMEOUT,          /* The HTTP request timed out. */
00130     FMOD_ERR_INITIALIZATION,        /* FMOD was not initialized correctly to support this function. */
00131     FMOD_ERR_INITIALIZED,           /* Cannot call this command after System::init. */
00132     FMOD_ERR_INTERNAL,              /* An error occured that wasn't supposed to.  Contact support. */
00133     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_ADDRESS,       /* On Xbox 360, this memory address passed to FMOD must be physical, (ie allocated with XPhysicalAlloc.) */
00134     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_FLOAT,         /* Value passed in was a NaN, Inf or denormalized float. */
00135     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_HANDLE,        /* An invalid object handle was used. */
00136     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_PARAM,         /* An invalid parameter was passed to this function. */
00137     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_POSITION,      /* An invalid seek position was passed to this function. */
00138     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_SPEAKER,       /* An invalid speaker was passed to this function based on the current speaker mode. */
00139     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_SYNCPOINT,     /* The syncpoint did not come from this sound handle. */
00140     FMOD_ERR_INVALID_VECTOR,        /* The vectors passed in are not unit length, or perpendicular. */
00141     FMOD_ERR_MAXAUDIBLE,            /* Reached maximum audible playback count for this sound's soundgroup. */
00142     FMOD_ERR_MEMORY,                /* Not enough memory or resources. */
00143     FMOD_ERR_MEMORY_CANTPOINT,      /* Can't use FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT on non PCM source data, or non mp3/xma/adpcm data if FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE was used. */
00144     FMOD_ERR_MEMORY_SRAM,           /* Not enough memory or resources on console sound ram. */
00145     FMOD_ERR_NEEDS2D,               /* Tried to call a command on a 3d sound when the command was meant for 2d sound. */
00146     FMOD_ERR_NEEDS3D,               /* Tried to call a command on a 2d sound when the command was meant for 3d sound. */
00147     FMOD_ERR_NEEDSHARDWARE,         /* Tried to use a feature that requires hardware support.  (ie trying to play a GCADPCM compressed sound in software on Wii). */
00148     FMOD_ERR_NEEDSSOFTWARE,         /* Tried to use a feature that requires the software engine.  Software engine has either been turned off, or command was executed on a hardware channel which does not support this feature. */
00149     FMOD_ERR_NET_CONNECT,           /* Couldn't connect to the specified host. */
00150     FMOD_ERR_NET_SOCKET_ERROR,      /* A socket error occurred.  This is a catch-all for socket-related errors not listed elsewhere. */
00151     FMOD_ERR_NET_URL,               /* The specified URL couldn't be resolved. */
00152     FMOD_ERR_NET_WOULD_BLOCK,       /* Operation on a non-blocking socket could not complete immediately. */
00153     FMOD_ERR_NOTREADY,              /* Operation could not be performed because specified sound/DSP connection is not ready. */
00154     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_ALLOCATED,      /* Error initializing output device, but more specifically, the output device is already in use and cannot be reused. */
00155     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_CREATEBUFFER,   /* Error creating hardware sound buffer. */
00156     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_DRIVERCALL,     /* A call to a standard soundcard driver failed, which could possibly mean a bug in the driver or resources were missing or exhausted. */
00157     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_ENUMERATION,    /* Error enumerating the available driver list. List may be inconsistent due to a recent device addition or removal. */
00158     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_FORMAT,         /* Soundcard does not support the minimum features needed for this soundsystem (16bit stereo output). */
00159     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_INIT,           /* Error initializing output device. */
00160     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_NOHARDWARE,     /* FMOD_HARDWARE was specified but the sound card does not have the resources necessary to play it. */
00161     FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_NOSOFTWARE,     /* Attempted to create a software sound but no software channels were specified in System::init. */
00162     FMOD_ERR_PAN,                   /* Panning only works with mono or stereo sound sources. */
00163     FMOD_ERR_PLUGIN,                /* An unspecified error has been returned from a 3rd party plugin. */
00164     FMOD_ERR_PLUGIN_INSTANCES,      /* The number of allowed instances of a plugin has been exceeded. */
00165     FMOD_ERR_PLUGIN_MISSING,        /* A requested output, dsp unit type or codec was not available. */
00166     FMOD_ERR_PLUGIN_RESOURCE,       /* A resource that the plugin requires cannot be found. (ie the DLS file for MIDI playback) */
00167     FMOD_ERR_PRELOADED,             /* The specified sound is still in use by the event system, call EventSystem::unloadFSB before trying to release it. */
00168     FMOD_ERR_PROGRAMMERSOUND,       /* The specified sound is still in use by the event system, wait for the event which is using it finish with it. */
00169     FMOD_ERR_RECORD,                /* An error occured trying to initialize the recording device. */
00170     FMOD_ERR_REVERB_INSTANCE,       /* Specified instance in FMOD_REVERB_PROPERTIES couldn't be set. Most likely because it is an invalid instance number or the reverb doesnt exist. */
00171     FMOD_ERR_SUBSOUND_ALLOCATED,    /* This subsound is already being used by another sound, you cannot have more than one parent to a sound.  Null out the other parent's entry first. */
00172     FMOD_ERR_SUBSOUND_CANTMOVE,     /* Shared subsounds cannot be replaced or moved from their parent stream, such as when the parent stream is an FSB file. */
00173     FMOD_ERR_SUBSOUND_MODE,         /* The subsound's mode bits do not match with the parent sound's mode bits.  See documentation for function that it was called with. */
00174     FMOD_ERR_SUBSOUNDS,             /* The error occured because the sound referenced contains subsounds when it shouldn't have, or it doesn't contain subsounds when it should have.  The operation may also not be able to be performed on a parent sound, or a parent sound was played without setting up a sentence first. */
00175     FMOD_ERR_TAGNOTFOUND,           /* The specified tag could not be found or there are no tags. */
00176     FMOD_ERR_TOOMANYCHANNELS,       /* The sound created exceeds the allowable input channel count.  This can be increased using the maxinputchannels parameter in System::setSoftwareFormat. */
00177     FMOD_ERR_UNIMPLEMENTED,         /* Something in FMOD hasn't been implemented when it should be! contact support! */
00178     FMOD_ERR_UNINITIALIZED,         /* This command failed because System::init or System::setDriver was not called. */
00179     FMOD_ERR_UNSUPPORTED,           /* A command issued was not supported by this object.  Possibly a plugin without certain callbacks specified. */
00180     FMOD_ERR_UPDATE,                /* An error caused by System::update occured. */
00181     FMOD_ERR_VERSION,               /* The version number of this file format is not supported. */
00182 
00183     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_FAILED,          /* An Event failed to be retrieved, most likely due to 'just fail' being specified as the max playbacks behavior. */
00184     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_INFOONLY,        /* Can't execute this command on an EVENT_INFOONLY event. */
00185     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_INTERNAL,        /* An error occured that wasn't supposed to.  See debug log for reason. */
00186     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_MAXSTREAMS,      /* Event failed because 'Max streams' was hit when FMOD_EVENT_INIT_FAIL_ON_MAXSTREAMS was specified. */
00187     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_MISMATCH,        /* FSB mismatches the FEV it was compiled with, the stream/sample mode it was meant to be created with was different, or the FEV was built for a different platform. */
00188     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_NAMECONFLICT,    /* A category with the same name already exists. */
00189     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_NOTFOUND,        /* The requested event, event group, event category or event property could not be found. */
00190     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_NEEDSSIMPLE,     /* Tried to call a function on a complex event that's only supported by simple events. */
00191     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_GUIDCONFLICT,    /* An event with the same GUID already exists. */
00192     FMOD_ERR_EVENT_ALREADY_LOADED,  /* The specified project has already been loaded. Having multiple copies of the same project loaded simultaneously is forbidden. */
00193 
00194     FMOD_ERR_MUSIC_UNINITIALIZED,   /* Music system is not initialized probably because no music data is loaded. */
00195     FMOD_ERR_MUSIC_NOTFOUND,        /* The requested music entity could not be found. */
00196     FMOD_ERR_MUSIC_NOCALLBACK,      /* The music callback is required, but it has not been set. */

00198     FMOD_RESULT_FORCEINT = 65536    /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00199 } FMOD_RESULT;

00203 /*
00204 [STRUCTURE] 
00205 [
00206     [DESCRIPTION]   
00207     Structure describing a point in 3D space.
00208 
00209     [REMARKS]
00210     FMOD uses a left handed co-ordinate system by default.<br>
00211     To use a right handed co-ordinate system specify FMOD_INIT_3D_RIGHTHANDED from FMOD_INITFLAGS in System::init.
00212 
00213     [PLATFORMS]
00214     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00215 
00216     [SEE_ALSO]      
00217     System::set3DListenerAttributes
00218     System::get3DListenerAttributes
00219     Channel::set3DAttributes
00220     Channel::get3DAttributes
00221     Channel::set3DCustomRolloff
00222     Channel::get3DCustomRolloff
00223     Sound::set3DCustomRolloff
00224     Sound::get3DCustomRolloff
00225     Geometry::addPolygon
00226     Geometry::setPolygonVertex
00227     Geometry::getPolygonVertex
00228     Geometry::setRotation
00229     Geometry::getRotation
00230     Geometry::setPosition
00231     Geometry::getPosition
00232     Geometry::setScale
00233     Geometry::getScale
00234     FMOD_INITFLAGS
00235 ]
00236 */
00237 typedef struct
00238 {
00239     float x;        /* X co-ordinate in 3D space. */
00240     float y;        /* Y co-ordinate in 3D space. */
00241     float z;        /* Z co-ordinate in 3D space. */
00242 } FMOD_VECTOR;

00244 /*
00245 [STRUCTURE] 
00246 [
00247     [DESCRIPTION]   
00248     Structure describing a globally unique identifier.
00249 
00250     [REMARKS]
00251 
00252     [PLATFORMS]
00253     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00254 
00255     [SEE_ALSO]      
00256     System::getDriverInfo
00257 ]
00258 */
00259 typedef struct
00260 {
00261     unsigned int   Data1;       /* Specifies the first 8 hexadecimal digits of the GUID */
00262     unsigned short Data2;       /* Specifies the first group of 4 hexadecimal digits.   */
00263     unsigned short Data3;       /* Specifies the second group of 4 hexadecimal digits.  */
00264     unsigned char  Data4[8];    /* Array of 8 bytes. The first 2 bytes contain the third group of 4 hexadecimal digits. The remaining 6 bytes contain the final 12 hexadecimal digits. */
00265 } FMOD_GUID;
00266 
00267 /*
00268 [STRUCTURE] 
00269 [
00270     [DESCRIPTION]
00271     Structure that is passed into FMOD_FILE_ASYNCREADCALLBACK.  Use the information in this structure to perform
00272 
00273     [REMARKS]
00274     Members marked with [r] mean the variable is modified by FMOD and is for reading purposes only.  Do not change this value.<br>
00275     Members marked with [w] mean the variable can be written to.  The user can set the value.<br>
00276     <br>
00277     Instructions: write to 'buffer', and 'bytesread' <b>BEFORE</b> setting 'result'.<br>  
00278     As soon as result is set, FMOD will asynchronously continue internally using the data provided in this structure.<br>
00279     <br>
00280     Set 'result' to the result expected from a normal file read callback.<br>
00281     If the read was successful, set it to FMOD_OK.<br>
00282     If it read some data but hit the end of the file, set it to FMOD_ERR_FILE_EOF.<br>
00283     If a bad error occurred, return FMOD_ERR_FILE_BAD<br>
00284     If a disk was ejected, return FMOD_ERR_FILE_DISKEJECTED.<br>
00285 
00286     [PLATFORMS]
00287     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00288 
00289     [SEE_ALSO]
00290     FMOD_FILE_ASYNCREADCALLBACK
00291     FMOD_FILE_ASYNCCANCELCALLBACK
00292 ]
00293 */
00294 typedef struct
00295 {
00296     void           *handle;         /* [r] The file handle that was filled out in the open callback. */
00297     unsigned int    offset;         /* [r] Seek position, make sure you read from this file offset. */
00298     unsigned int    sizebytes;      /* [r] how many bytes requested for read. */
00299     int             priority;       /* [r] 0 = low importance.  100 = extremely important (ie 'must read now or stuttering may occur') */
00300 
00301     void           *buffer;         /* [w] Buffer to read file data into. */
00302     unsigned int    bytesread;      /* [w] Fill this in before setting result code to tell FMOD how many bytes were read. */
00303     FMOD_RESULT     result;         /* [r/w] Result code, FMOD_OK tells the system it is ready to consume the data.  Set this last!  Default value = FMOD_ERR_NOTREADY. */
00304 
00305     void           *userdata;       /* [r] User data pointer. */
00306 } FMOD_ASYNCREADINFO;
00307 
00308 
00309 /*
00310 [ENUM]
00311 [
00312     [DESCRIPTION]   
00313     These output types are used with System::setOutput / System::getOutput, to choose which output method to use.
00314   
00315     [REMARKS]
00316     To pass information to the driver when initializing fmod use the extradriverdata parameter in System::init for the following reasons.<br>
00317     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER - extradriverdata is a pointer to a char * filename that the wav writer will output to.
00318     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER_NRT - extradriverdata is a pointer to a char * filename that the wav writer will output to.
00319     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_DSOUND - extradriverdata is a pointer to a HWND so that FMOD can set the focus on the audio for a particular window.
00320     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_PS3 - extradriverdata is a pointer to a FMOD_PS3_EXTRADRIVERDATA struct. This can be found in fmodps3.h.
00321     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_GC - extradriverdata is a pointer to a FMOD_GC_INFO struct. This can be found in fmodgc.h.
00322     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WII - extradriverdata is a pointer to a FMOD_WII_INFO struct. This can be found in fmodwii.h.
00323     <li>FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_ALSA - extradriverdata is a pointer to a FMOD_LINUX_EXTRADRIVERDATA struct. This can be found in fmodlinux.h.<br>
00324     <br>
00325     Currently these are the only FMOD drivers that take extra information.  Other unknown plugins may have different requirements.
00326     <br><br>
00327     Note! If FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER_NRT or FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_NOSOUND_NRT are used, and if the System::update function is being called
00328     very quickly (ie for a non realtime decode) it may be being called too quickly for the FMOD streamer thread to respond to.  
00329     The result will be a skipping/stuttering output in the captured audio.<br>
00330     <br>
00331     To remedy this, disable the FMOD Ex streamer thread, and use FMOD_INIT_STREAM_FROM_UPDATE to avoid skipping in the output stream,
00332     as it will lock the mixer and the streamer together in the same thread.
00333 
00334     [PLATFORMS]
00335     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00336 
00337     [SEE_ALSO]      
00338     System::setOutput
00339     System::getOutput
00340     System::setSoftwareFormat
00341     System::getSoftwareFormat
00342     System::init
00343     System::update
00344     FMOD_INITFLAGS
00345 ]
00346 */
00347 typedef enum
00348 {
00349     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_AUTODETECT,      /* Picks the best output mode for the platform.  This is the default. */
00350                                      
00351     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_UNKNOWN,         /* All             - 3rd party plugin, unknown.  This is for use with System::getOutput only. */
00352     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_NOSOUND,         /* All             - All calls in this mode succeed but make no sound. */
00353     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER,       /* All             - Writes output to fmodoutput.wav by default.  Use the 'extradriverdata' parameter in System::init, by simply passing the filename as a string, to set the wav filename. */
00354     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_NOSOUND_NRT,     /* All             - Non-realtime version of FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_NOSOUND.  User can drive mixer with System::update at whatever rate they want. */
00355     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER_NRT,   /* All             - Non-realtime version of FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WAVWRITER.  User can drive mixer with System::update at whatever rate they want. */
00356                                      
00357     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_DSOUND,          /* Win32/Win64     - DirectSound output.                       (Default on Windows XP and below) */
00358     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WINMM,           /* Win32/Win64     - Windows Multimedia output. */
00359     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WASAPI,          /* Win32           - Windows Audio Session API.                (Default on Windows Vista and above) */
00360     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_ASIO,            /* Win32           - Low latency ASIO 2.0 driver. */
00361     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_OSS,             /* Linux/Linux64   - Open Sound System output.                 (Default on Linux, third preference) */
00362     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_ALSA,            /* Linux/Linux64   - Advanced Linux Sound Architecture output. (Default on Linux, second preference if available) */
00363     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_ESD,             /* Linux/Linux64   - Enlightment Sound Daemon output. */
00364     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_PULSEAUDIO,      /* Linux/Linux64   - PulseAudio output.                        (Default on Linux, first preference if available) */
00365     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_COREAUDIO,       /* Mac             - Macintosh CoreAudio output.               (Default on Mac) */
00366     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_XBOX360,         /* Xbox 360        - Native Xbox360 output.                    (Default on Xbox 360) */
00367     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_PSP,             /* PSP             - Native PSP output.                        (Default on PSP) */
00368     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_PS3,             /* PS3             - Native PS3 output.                        (Default on PS3) */
00369     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_NGP,             /* NGP             - Native NGP output.                        (Default on NGP) */
00370     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_WII,             /* Wii             - Native Wii output.                        (Default on Wii) */
00371     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_3DS,             /* 3DS             - Native 3DS output                         (Default on 3DS) */
00372     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_AUDIOTRACK,      /* Android         - Java Audio Track output.                  (Default on Android 2.2 and below) */
00373     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_OPENSL,          /* Android         - OpenSL ES output.                         (Default on Android 2.3 and above) */   
00374 
00375     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_MAX,             /* Maximum number of output types supported. */
00376     FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00377 } FMOD_OUTPUTTYPE;
00378 
00379 
00380 /*
00381 [DEFINE] 
00382 [
00383     [NAME]
00384     FMOD_CAPS
00385 
00386     [DESCRIPTION]   
00387     Bit fields to use with System::getDriverCaps to determine the capabilities of a card / output device.
00388 
00389     [REMARKS]
00390     It is important to check FMOD_CAPS_HARDWARE_EMULATED on windows machines, to then adjust System::setDSPBufferSize to (1024, 10) to compensate for the higher latency.
00391 
00392     [PLATFORMS]
00393     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00394 
00395     [SEE_ALSO]
00396     System::getDriverCaps
00397     System::setDSPBufferSize
00398 ]
00399 */
00400 #define FMOD_CAPS_NONE                   0x00000000  /* Device has no special capabilities. */
00401 #define FMOD_CAPS_HARDWARE               0x00000001  /* Device supports hardware mixing. */
00402 #define FMOD_CAPS_HARDWARE_EMULATED      0x00000002  /* User has device set to 'Hardware acceleration = off' in control panel, and now extra 200ms latency is incurred. */
00403 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_MULTICHANNEL    0x00000004  /* Device can do multichannel output, ie greater than 2 channels. */
00404 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_FORMAT_PCM8     0x00000008  /* Device can output to 8bit integer PCM. */
00405 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_FORMAT_PCM16    0x00000010  /* Device can output to 16bit integer PCM. */
00406 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_FORMAT_PCM24    0x00000020  /* Device can output to 24bit integer PCM. */
00407 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_FORMAT_PCM32    0x00000040  /* Device can output to 32bit integer PCM. */
00408 #define FMOD_CAPS_OUTPUT_FORMAT_PCMFLOAT 0x00000080  /* Device can output to 32bit floating point PCM. */
00409 #define FMOD_CAPS_REVERB_LIMITED         0x00002000  /* Device supports some form of limited hardware reverb, maybe parameterless and only selectable by environment. */
00410 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00411 
00412 /*
00413 [DEFINE] 
00414 [
00415     [NAME]
00416     FMOD_DEBUGLEVEL
00417 
00418     [DESCRIPTION]   
00419     Bit fields to use with FMOD::Debug_SetLevel / FMOD::Debug_GetLevel to control the level of tty debug output with logging versions of FMOD (fmodL).
00420 
00421     [REMARKS]
00422 
00423     [PLATFORMS]
00424     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00425 
00426     [SEE_ALSO]
00427     Debug_SetLevel 
00428     Debug_GetLevel
00429 ]
00430 */
00431 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_NONE           0x00000000
00432 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_LOG            0x00000001      /* Will display generic logging messages. */
00433 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_ERROR          0x00000002      /* Will display errors. */
00434 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_WARNING        0x00000004      /* Will display warnings that are not fatal. */
00435 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_HINT           0x00000008      /* Will hint to you if there is something possibly better you could be doing. */
00436 #define FMOD_DEBUG_LEVEL_ALL            0x000000FF    
00437 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_MEMORY          0x00000100      /* Show FMOD memory related logging messages. */
00438 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_THREAD          0x00000200      /* Show FMOD thread related logging messages. */
00439 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_FILE            0x00000400      /* Show FMOD file system related logging messages. */
00440 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_NET             0x00000800      /* Show FMOD network related logging messages. */
00441 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_EVENT           0x00001000      /* Show FMOD Event related logging messages. */
00442 #define FMOD_DEBUG_TYPE_ALL             0x0000FFFF                      
00443 #define FMOD_DEBUG_DISPLAY_TIMESTAMPS   0x01000000      /* Display the timestamp of the log entry in milliseconds. */
00444 #define FMOD_DEBUG_DISPLAY_LINENUMBERS  0x02000000      /* Display the FMOD Ex source code line numbers, for debugging purposes. */
00445 #define FMOD_DEBUG_DISPLAY_COMPRESS     0x04000000      /* If a message is repeated more than 5 times it will stop displaying it and instead display the number of times the message was logged. */
00446 #define FMOD_DEBUG_DISPLAY_THREAD       0x08000000      /* Display the thread ID of the calling function that caused this log entry to appear. */
00447 #define FMOD_DEBUG_DISPLAY_ALL          0x0F000000
00448 #define FMOD_DEBUG_ALL                  0xFFFFFFFF
00449 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00450 
00451 
00452 /*
00453 [DEFINE] 
00454 [
00455     [NAME]
00456     FMOD_MEMORY_TYPE
00457 
00458     [DESCRIPTION]   
00459     Bit fields for memory allocation type being passed into FMOD memory callbacks.
00460 
00461     [REMARKS]
00462     Remember this is a bitfield.  You may get more than 1 bit set (ie physical + persistent) so do not simply switch on the types!  You must check each bit individually or clear out the bits that you do not want within the callback.<br>
00463     Bits can be excluded if you want during Memory_Initialize so that you never get them.
00464 
00465     [PLATFORMS]
00466     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00467 
00468     [SEE_ALSO]
00469     FMOD_MEMORY_ALLOCCALLBACK
00470     FMOD_MEMORY_REALLOCCALLBACK
00471     FMOD_MEMORY_FREECALLBACK
00472     Memory_Initialize
00473     
00474 ]
00475 */
00476 #define FMOD_MEMORY_NORMAL             0x00000000       /* Standard memory. */
00477 #define FMOD_MEMORY_STREAM_FILE        0x00000001       /* Stream file buffer, size controllable with System::setStreamBufferSize. */
00478 #define FMOD_MEMORY_STREAM_DECODE      0x00000002       /* Stream decode buffer, size controllable with FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO::decodebuffersize. */
00479 #define FMOD_MEMORY_SAMPLEDATA         0x00000004       /* Sample data buffer.  Raw audio data, usually PCM/MPEG/ADPCM/XMA data. */
00480 #define FMOD_MEMORY_DSP_OUTPUTBUFFER   0x00000008       /* DSP memory block allocated when more than 1 output exists on a DSP node. */
00481 #define FMOD_MEMORY_XBOX360_PHYSICAL   0x00100000       /* Requires XPhysicalAlloc / XPhysicalFree. */
00482 #define FMOD_MEMORY_PERSISTENT         0x00200000       /* Persistent memory. Memory will be freed when System::release is called. */
00483 #define FMOD_MEMORY_SECONDARY          0x00400000       /* Secondary memory. Allocation should be in secondary memory. For example RSX on the PS3. */
00484 #define FMOD_MEMORY_ALL                0xFFFFFFFF
00485 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00486 
00487 
00488 /*
00489 [ENUM]
00490 [
00491     [DESCRIPTION]   
00492     These are speaker types defined for use with the System::setSpeakerMode or System::getSpeakerMode command.
00493 
00494     [REMARKS]
00495     These are important notes on speaker modes in regards to sounds created with FMOD_SOFTWARE.<br>
00496     Note below the phrase 'sound channels' is used.  These are the subchannels inside a sound, they are not related and 
00497     have nothing to do with the FMOD class "Channel".<br>
00498     For example a mono sound has 1 sound channel, a stereo sound has 2 sound channels, and an AC3 or 6 channel wav file have 6 "sound channels".<br>
00499     <br>
00500     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_RAW<br>
00501     ---------------------<br>
00502     This mode is for output devices that are not specifically mono/stereo/quad/surround/5.1 or 7.1, but are multichannel.<br>
00503     Use System::setSoftwareFormat to specify the number of speakers you want to address, otherwise it will default to 2 (stereo).<br>
00504     Sound channels map to speakers sequentially, so a mono sound maps to output speaker 0, stereo sound maps to output speaker 0 & 1.<br>
00505     The user assumes knowledge of the speaker order.  FMOD_SPEAKER enumerations may not apply, so raw channel indices should be used.<br>
00506     Multichannel sounds map input channels to output channels 1:1. <br>
00507     Channel::setPan and Channel::setSpeakerMix do not work.<br>
00508     Speaker levels must be manually set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00509     <br>
00510     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MONO<br>
00511     ---------------------<br>
00512     This mode is for a 1 speaker arrangement.<br>
00513     Panning does not work in this speaker mode.<br>
00514     Mono, stereo and multichannel sounds have each sound channel played on the one speaker unity.<br>
00515     Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00516     Channel::setSpeakerMix does not work.<br>
00517     <br>
00518     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_STEREO<br>
00519     -----------------------<br>
00520     This mode is for 2 speaker arrangements that have a left and right speaker.<br>
00521     <li>Mono sounds default to an even distribution between left and right.  They can be panned with Channel::setPan.<br>
00522     <li>Stereo sounds default to the middle, or full left in the left speaker and full right in the right speaker.  
00523     <li>They can be cross faded with Channel::setPan.<br>
00524     <li>Multichannel sounds have each sound channel played on each speaker at unity.<br>
00525     <li>Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00526     <li>Channel::setSpeakerMix works but only front left and right parameters are used, the rest are ignored.<br>
00527     <br>
00528     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_QUAD<br>
00529     ------------------------<br>
00530     This mode is for 4 speaker arrangements that have a front left, front right, rear left and a rear right speaker.<br>
00531     <li>Mono sounds default to an even distribution between front left and front right.  They can be panned with Channel::setPan.<br>
00532     <li>Stereo sounds default to the left sound channel played on the front left, and the right sound channel played on the front right.<br>
00533     <li>They can be cross faded with Channel::setPan.<br>
00534     <li>Multichannel sounds default to all of their sound channels being played on each speaker in order of input.<br>
00535     <li>Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00536     <li>Channel::setSpeakerMix works but side left, side right, center and lfe are ignored.<br>
00537     <br>
00538     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_SURROUND<br>
00539     ------------------------<br>
00540     This mode is for 5 speaker arrangements that have a left/right/center/rear left/rear right.<br>
00541     <li>Mono sounds default to the center speaker.  They can be panned with Channel::setPan.<br>
00542     <li>Stereo sounds default to the left sound channel played on the front left, and the right sound channel played on the front right.  
00543     <li>They can be cross faded with Channel::setPan.<br>
00544     <li>Multichannel sounds default to all of their sound channels being played on each speaker in order of input.  
00545     <li>Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00546     <li>Channel::setSpeakerMix works but side left / side right are ignored.<br>
00547     <br>
00548     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_5POINT1<br>
00549     ------------------------<br>
00550     This mode is for 5.1 speaker arrangements that have a left/right/center/rear left/rear right and a subwoofer speaker.<br>
00551     <li>Mono sounds default to the center speaker.  They can be panned with Channel::setPan.<br>
00552     <li>Stereo sounds default to the left sound channel played on the front left, and the right sound channel played on the front right.  
00553     <li>They can be cross faded with Channel::setPan.<br>
00554     <li>Multichannel sounds default to all of their sound channels being played on each speaker in order of input.  
00555     <li>Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00556     <li>Channel::setSpeakerMix works but side left / side right are ignored.<br>
00557     <br>
00558     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_7POINT1<br>
00559     ------------------------<br>
00560     This mode is for 7.1 speaker arrangements that have a left/right/center/rear left/rear right/side left/side right 
00561     and a subwoofer speaker.<br>
00562     <li>Mono sounds default to the center speaker.  They can be panned with Channel::setPan.<br>
00563     <li>Stereo sounds default to the left sound channel played on the front left, and the right sound channel played on the front right.  
00564     <li>They can be cross faded with Channel::setPan.<br>
00565     <li>Multichannel sounds default to all of their sound channels being played on each speaker in order of input.  
00566     <li>Mix behavior for multichannel sounds can be set with Channel::setSpeakerLevels.<br>
00567     <li>Channel::setSpeakerMix works and every parameter is used to set the balance of a sound in any speaker.<br>
00568     <br>
00569     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_PROLOGIC<br>
00570     ------------------------------------------------------<br>
00571     This mode is for mono, stereo, 5.1 and 7.1 speaker arrangements, as it is backwards and forwards compatible with stereo, 
00572     but to get a surround effect a Dolby Prologic or Prologic 2 hardware decoder / amplifier is needed.<br>
00573     Pan behavior is the same as FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_5POINT1.<br>
00574     <br>
00575     If this function is called the numoutputchannels setting in System::setSoftwareFormat is overwritten.<br>
00576     <br>
00577     Output rate must be 44100, 48000 or 96000 for this to work otherwise FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_INIT will be returned.<br>
00578 
00579     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MYEARS<br>
00580     ------------------------------------------------------<br>
00581     This mode is for headphones.  This will attempt to load a MyEars profile (see myears.net.au) and use it to generate
00582     surround sound on headphones using a personalized HRTF algorithm, for realistic 3d sound.<br>
00583     Pan behavior is the same as FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_7POINT1.<br>
00584     MyEars speaker mode will automatically be set if the speakermode is FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_STEREO and the MyEars profile exists.<br>
00585     If this mode is set explicitly, FMOD_INIT_DISABLE_MYEARS_AUTODETECT has no effect.<br>
00586     If this mode is set explicitly and the MyEars profile does not exist, FMOD_ERR_OUTPUT_DRIVERCALL will be returned.
00587 
00588     [PLATFORMS]
00589     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00590 
00591     [SEE_ALSO]
00592     System::setSpeakerMode
00593     System::getSpeakerMode
00594     System::getDriverCaps
00595     System::setSoftwareFormat
00596     Channel::setSpeakerLevels
00597 ]
00598 */
00599 typedef enum
00600 {
00601     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_RAW,              /* There is no specific speakermode.  Sound channels are mapped in order of input to output.  Use System::setSoftwareFormat to specify speaker count. See remarks for more information. */
00602     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MONO,             /* The speakers are monaural. */
00603     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_STEREO,           /* The speakers are stereo (DEFAULT). */
00604     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_QUAD,             /* 4 speaker setup.  This includes front left, front right, rear left, rear right.  */
00605     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_SURROUND,         /* 5 speaker setup.  This includes front left, front right, center, rear left, rear right. */
00606     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_5POINT1,          /* 5.1 speaker setup.  This includes front left, front right, center, rear left, rear right and a subwoofer. */
00607     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_7POINT1,          /* 7.1 speaker setup.  This includes front left, front right, center, rear left, rear right, side left, side right and a subwoofer. */
00608     
00609     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_PROLOGIC,         /* Stereo output, but data is encoded to be played on a Prologic 2 / CircleSurround decoder in 5.1 via an analog connection.  See remarks about limitations. */
00610     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MYEARS,           /* Stereo output, but data is encoded using personalized HRTF algorithms.  See myears.net.au */
00611 
00612     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MAX,              /* Maximum number of speaker modes supported. */
00613     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_FORCEINT = 65536  /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00614 } FMOD_SPEAKERMODE;
00615 
00616 
00617 /*
00618 [ENUM]
00619 [
00620     [DESCRIPTION]   
00621     These are speaker types defined for use with the Channel::setSpeakerLevels command.
00622     It can also be used for speaker placement in the System::set3DSpeakerPosition command.
00623 
00624     [REMARKS]
00625     If you are using FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_RAW and speaker assignments are meaningless, just cast a raw integer value to this type.<br>
00626     For example (FMOD_SPEAKER)7 would use the 7th speaker (also the same as FMOD_SPEAKER_SIDE_RIGHT).<br>
00627     Values higher than this can be used if an output system has more than 8 speaker types / output channels.  15 is the current maximum.<br>
00628     <br>
00629     NOTE: On Playstation 3 in 7.1, the extra 2 speakers are not side left/side right, they are 'surround back left'/'surround back right' which
00630     locate the speakers behind the listener instead of to the sides like on PC.  FMOD_SPEAKER_SBL/FMOD_SPEAKER_SBR are provided to make it 
00631     clearer what speaker is being addressed on that platform.
00632 
00633     [PLATFORMS]
00634     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00635 
00636     [SEE_ALSO]
00637     FMOD_SPEAKERMODE
00638     Channel::setSpeakerLevels
00639     Channel::getSpeakerLevels
00640     System::set3DSpeakerPosition
00641     System::get3DSpeakerPosition
00642 ]
00643 */
00644 typedef enum
00645 {
00646     FMOD_SPEAKER_FRONT_LEFT,
00647     FMOD_SPEAKER_FRONT_RIGHT,
00648     FMOD_SPEAKER_FRONT_CENTER,
00649     FMOD_SPEAKER_LOW_FREQUENCY,
00650     FMOD_SPEAKER_BACK_LEFT,
00651     FMOD_SPEAKER_BACK_RIGHT,
00652     FMOD_SPEAKER_SIDE_LEFT,
00653     FMOD_SPEAKER_SIDE_RIGHT,
00654     
00655     FMOD_SPEAKER_MAX,                                       /* Maximum number of speaker types supported. */
00656     FMOD_SPEAKER_MONO        = FMOD_SPEAKER_FRONT_LEFT,     /* For use with FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MONO and Channel::SetSpeakerLevels.  Mapped to same value as FMOD_SPEAKER_FRONT_LEFT. */
00657     FMOD_SPEAKER_NULL        = FMOD_SPEAKER_MAX,            /* A non speaker.  Use this to send. */
00658     FMOD_SPEAKER_SBL         = FMOD_SPEAKER_SIDE_LEFT,      /* For use with FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_7POINT1 on PS3 where the extra speakers are surround back inside of side speakers. */
00659     FMOD_SPEAKER_SBR         = FMOD_SPEAKER_SIDE_RIGHT,     /* For use with FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_7POINT1 on PS3 where the extra speakers are surround back inside of side speakers. */
00660     FMOD_SPEAKER_FORCEINT    = 65536                        /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00661 } FMOD_SPEAKER;
00662 
00663 
00664 /*
00665 [ENUM]
00666 [
00667     [DESCRIPTION]   
00668     These are plugin types defined for use with the System::getNumPlugins, 
00669     System::getPluginInfo and System::unloadPlugin functions.
00670 
00671     [REMARKS]
00672 
00673     [PLATFORMS]
00674     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00675 
00676     [SEE_ALSO]
00677     System::getNumPlugins
00678     System::getPluginInfo
00679     System::unloadPlugin
00680 ]
00681 */
00682 typedef enum
00683 {
00684     FMOD_PLUGINTYPE_OUTPUT,          /* The plugin type is an output module.  FMOD mixed audio will play through one of these devices */
00685     FMOD_PLUGINTYPE_CODEC,           /* The plugin type is a file format codec.  FMOD will use these codecs to load file formats for playback. */
00686     FMOD_PLUGINTYPE_DSP,             /* The plugin type is a DSP unit.  FMOD will use these plugins as part of its DSP network to apply effects to output or generate sound in realtime. */
00687 
00688     FMOD_PLUGINTYPE_MAX,             /* Maximum number of plugin types supported. */
00689     FMOD_PLUGINTYPE_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00690 } FMOD_PLUGINTYPE;
00691 
00692 
00693 /*
00694 [DEFINE]
00695 [
00696     [NAME]
00697     FMOD_INITFLAGS
00698 
00699     [DESCRIPTION]   
00700     Initialization flags.  Use them with System::init in the flags parameter to change various behavior.  
00701 
00702     [REMARKS]
00703     Use System::setAdvancedSettings to adjust settings for some of the features that are enabled by these flags.
00704 
00705     [PLATFORMS]
00706     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00707 
00708     [SEE_ALSO]
00709     System::init
00710     System::update 
00711     System::setAdvancedSettings
00712     Channel::set3DOcclusion
00713 ]
00714 */
00715 #define FMOD_INIT_NORMAL                     0x00000000 /* All platforms - Initialize normally */
00716 #define FMOD_INIT_STREAM_FROM_UPDATE         0x00000001 /* All platforms - No stream thread is created internally.  Streams are driven from System::update.  Mainly used with non-realtime outputs. */
00717 #define FMOD_INIT_3D_RIGHTHANDED             0x00000002 /* All platforms - FMOD will treat +X as right, +Y as up and +Z as backwards (towards you). */
00718 #define FMOD_INIT_SOFTWARE_DISABLE           0x00000004 /* All platforms - Disable software mixer to save memory.  Anything created with FMOD_SOFTWARE will fail and DSP will not work. */
00719 #define FMOD_INIT_SOFTWARE_OCCLUSION         0x00000008 /* All platforms - All FMOD_SOFTWARE with FMOD_3D based voices will add a software lowpass filter effect into the DSP chain which is automatically used when Channel::set3DOcclusion is used or the geometry API. */
00720 #define FMOD_INIT_SOFTWARE_HRTF              0x00000010 /* All platforms - All FMOD_SOFTWARE with FMOD_3D based voices will add a software lowpass filter effect into the DSP chain which causes sounds to sound duller when the sound goes behind the listener.  Use System::setAdvancedSettings to adjust cutoff frequency. */
00721 #define FMOD_INIT_DISTANCE_FILTERING         0x00000200 /* All platforms - All FMOD_SOFTWARE with FMOD_3D based voices will add a software lowpass and highpass filter effect into the DSP chain which will act as a distance-automated bandpass filter. Use System::setAdvancedSettings to adjust the centre frequency. */
00722 #define FMOD_INIT_SOFTWARE_REVERB_LOWMEM     0x00000040 /* All platforms - SFX reverb is run using 22/24khz delay buffers, halving the memory required. */
00723 #define FMOD_INIT_ENABLE_PROFILE             0x00000020 /* All platforms - Enable TCP/IP based host which allows FMOD Designer or FMOD Profiler to connect to it, and view memory, CPU and the DSP network graph in real-time. */
00724 #define FMOD_INIT_VOL0_BECOMES_VIRTUAL       0x00000080 /* All platforms - Any sounds that are 0 volume will go virtual and not be processed except for having their positions updated virtually.  Use System::setAdvancedSettings to adjust what volume besides zero to switch to virtual at. */
00725 #define FMOD_INIT_WASAPI_EXCLUSIVE           0x00000100 /* Win32 Vista only - for WASAPI output - Enable exclusive access to hardware, lower latency at the expense of excluding other applications from accessing the audio hardware. */
00726 #define FMOD_INIT_PS3_PREFERDTS              0x00800000 /* PS3 only - Prefer DTS over Dolby Digital if both are supported. Note: 8 and 6 channel LPCM is always preferred over both DTS and Dolby Digital. */
00727 #define FMOD_INIT_PS3_FORCE2CHLPCM           0x01000000 /* PS3 only - Force PS3 system output mode to 2 channel LPCM. */
00728 #define FMOD_INIT_DISABLEDOLBY               0x00100000 /* Wii / 3DS - Disable Dolby Pro Logic surround. Speakermode will be set to STEREO even if user has selected surround in the system settings. */
00729 #define FMOD_INIT_SYSTEM_MUSICMUTENOTPAUSE   0x00200000 /* Xbox 360 / PS3 - The "music" channelgroup which by default pauses when custom 360 dashboard / PS3 BGM music is played, can be changed to mute (therefore continues playing) instead of pausing, by using this flag. */
00730 #define FMOD_INIT_SYNCMIXERWITHUPDATE        0x00400000 /* Win32/Wii/PS3/Xbox/Xbox 360 - FMOD Mixer thread is woken up to do a mix when System::update is called rather than waking periodically on its own timer. */
00731 #define FMOD_INIT_GEOMETRY_USECLOSEST        0x04000000 /* All platforms - With the geometry engine, only process the closest polygon rather than accumulating all polygons the sound to listener line intersects. */
00732 #define FMOD_INIT_DISABLE_MYEARS_AUTODETECT  0x08000000 /* Win32 - Disables automatic setting of FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_STEREO to FMOD_SPEAKERMODE_MYEARS if the MyEars profile exists on the PC.  MyEars is HRTF 7.1 downmixing through headphones. */
00733 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00734 
00735 
00736 /*
00737 [ENUM]
00738 [
00739     [DESCRIPTION]   
00740     These definitions describe the type of song being played.
00741 
00742     [REMARKS]
00743 
00744     [PLATFORMS]
00745     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00746 
00747     [SEE_ALSO]      
00748     Sound::getFormat
00749 ]
00750 */
00751 typedef enum
00752 {
00753     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_UNKNOWN,         /* 3rd party / unknown plugin format. */
00754     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_AIFF,            /* AIFF. */
00755     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_ASF,             /* Microsoft Advanced Systems Format (ie WMA/ASF/WMV). */
00756     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_AT3,             /* Sony ATRAC 3 format */
00757     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_CDDA,            /* Digital CD audio. */
00758     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_DLS,             /* Sound font / downloadable sound bank. */
00759     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_FLAC,            /* FLAC lossless codec. */
00760     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_FSB,             /* FMOD Sample Bank. */
00761     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_GCADPCM,         /* Nintendo GameCube/Wii ADPCM */
00762     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_IT,              /* Impulse Tracker. */
00763     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_MIDI,            /* MIDI. extracodecdata is a pointer to an FMOD_MIDI_EXTRACODECDATA structure. */
00764     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_MOD,             /* Protracker / Fasttracker MOD. */
00765     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_MPEG,            /* MP2/MP3 MPEG. */
00766     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_OGGVORBIS,       /* Ogg vorbis. */
00767     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_PLAYLIST,        /* Information only from ASX/PLS/M3U/WAX playlists */
00768     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_RAW,             /* Raw PCM data. */
00769     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_S3M,             /* ScreamTracker 3. */
00770     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_SF2,             /* Sound font 2 format. */
00771     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_USER,            /* User created sound. */
00772     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_WAV,             /* Microsoft WAV. */
00773     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_XM,              /* FastTracker 2 XM. */
00774     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_XMA,             /* Xbox360 XMA */
00775     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_VAG,             /* PlayStation Portable ADPCM VAG format. */
00776     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_AUDIOQUEUE,      /* iPhone hardware decoder, supports AAC, ALAC and MP3. extracodecdata is a pointer to an FMOD_AUDIOQUEUE_EXTRACODECDATA structure. */
00777     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_XWMA,            /* Xbox360 XWMA */
00778     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_BCWAV,           /* 3DS BCWAV container format for DSP ADPCM and PCM */
00779     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_AT9,             /* NGP ATRAC 9 format */
00780 
00781     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_MAX,             /* Maximum number of sound types supported. */
00782     FMOD_SOUND_TYPE_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00783 } FMOD_SOUND_TYPE;
00784 
00785 
00786 /*
00787 [ENUM]
00788 [
00789     [DESCRIPTION]   
00790     These definitions describe the native format of the hardware or software buffer that will be used.
00791 
00792     [REMARKS]
00793     This is the format the native hardware or software buffer will be or is created in.
00794 
00795     [PLATFORMS]
00796     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00797 
00798     [SEE_ALSO]
00799     System::createSound
00800     Sound::getFormat
00801 ]
00802 */
00803 typedef enum
00804 {
00805     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_NONE,             /* Unitialized / unknown. */
00806     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_PCM8,             /* 8bit integer PCM data. */
00807     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_PCM16,            /* 16bit integer PCM data. */
00808     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_PCM24,            /* 24bit integer PCM data. */
00809     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_PCM32,            /* 32bit integer PCM data. */
00810     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_PCMFLOAT,         /* 32bit floating point PCM data. */
00811     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_GCADPCM,          /* Compressed Nintendo GameCube/Wii DSP data. */
00812     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_IMAADPCM,         /* Compressed IMA ADPCM / Xbox ADPCM data. */
00813     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_VAG,              /* Compressed PlayStation Portable ADPCM data. */
00814     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_HEVAG,            /* Compressed NGP ADPCM data. */
00815     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_XMA,              /* Compressed Xbox360 data. */
00816     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_MPEG,             /* Compressed MPEG layer 2 or 3 data. */
00817     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_CELT,             /* Compressed CELT data. */
00818 
00819     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_MAX,              /* Maximum number of sound formats supported. */   
00820     FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT_FORCEINT = 65536  /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00821 } FMOD_SOUND_FORMAT;
00822 
00823 
00824 /*
00825 [DEFINE]
00826 [
00827     [NAME] 
00828     FMOD_MODE
00829 
00830     [DESCRIPTION]   
00831     Sound description bitfields, bitwise OR them together for loading and describing sounds.
00832 
00833     [REMARKS]
00834     By default a sound will open as a static sound that is decompressed fully into memory to PCM. (ie equivalent of FMOD_CREATESAMPLE)<br>
00835     To have a sound stream instead, use FMOD_CREATESTREAM, or use the wrapper function System::createStream.<br>
00836     Some opening modes (ie FMOD_OPENUSER, FMOD_OPENMEMORY, FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT, FMOD_OPENRAW) will need extra information.<br>
00837     This can be provided using the FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO structure.
00838     <br>
00839     Specifying FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT will POINT to your memory rather allocating its own sound buffers and duplicating it internally.<br>
00840     <b><u>This means you cannot free the memory while FMOD is using it, until after Sound::release is called.</b></u>
00841     With FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT, for PCM formats, only WAV, FSB, and RAW are supported.  For compressed formats, only those formats supported by FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE are supported.<br>
00842     With FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT and FMOD_OPENRAW or PCM, if using them together, note that you must pad the data on each side by 16 bytes.  This is so fmod can modify the ends of the data for looping/interpolation/mixing purposes.  If a wav file, you will need to insert silence, and then reset loop points to stop the playback from playing that silence.<br>
00843     With FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT, For Wii/PSP FMOD_HARDWARE supports this flag for the GCADPCM/VAG formats.  On other platforms FMOD_SOFTWARE must be used.<br>
00844     <br>
00845     <b>Xbox 360 memory</b> On Xbox 360 Specifying FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT to a virtual memory address will cause FMOD_ERR_INVALID_ADDRESS
00846     to be returned.  Use physical memory only for this functionality.<br>
00847     <br>
00848     FMOD_LOWMEM is used on a sound if you want to minimize the memory overhead, by having FMOD not allocate memory for certain 
00849     features that are not likely to be used in a game environment.  These are :<br>
00850     1. Sound::getName functionality is removed.  256 bytes per sound is saved.<br>
00851 
00852     [PLATFORMS]
00853     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00854 
00855     [SEE_ALSO]
00856     System::createSound
00857     System::createStream
00858     Sound::setMode
00859     Sound::getMode
00860     Channel::setMode
00861     Channel::getMode
00862     Sound::set3DCustomRolloff
00863     Channel::set3DCustomRolloff
00864     Sound::getOpenState
00865 ]
00866 */
00867 #define FMOD_DEFAULT                   0x00000000  /* FMOD_DEFAULT is a default sound type.  Equivalent to all the defaults listed below.  FMOD_LOOP_OFF, FMOD_2D, FMOD_HARDWARE.  (Note - only Windows with a high spec soundcard, PSP, and Wii support FMOD_HARDWARE) */
00868 #define FMOD_LOOP_OFF                  0x00000001  /* For non looping sounds. (DEFAULT).  Overrides FMOD_LOOP_NORMAL / FMOD_LOOP_BIDI. */
00869 #define FMOD_LOOP_NORMAL               0x00000002  /* For forward looping sounds. */
00870 #define FMOD_LOOP_BIDI                 0x00000004  /* For bidirectional looping sounds. (only works on software mixed static sounds). */
00871 #define FMOD_2D                        0x00000008  /* Ignores any 3d processing. (DEFAULT). */
00872 #define FMOD_3D                        0x00000010  /* Makes the sound positionable in 3D.  Overrides FMOD_2D. */
00873 #define FMOD_HARDWARE                  0x00000020  /* Attempts to make sounds use hardware acceleration. (DEFAULT).  Note on platforms that don't support FMOD_HARDWARE (only Windows with a high spec soundcard, PSP, and Wii support FMOD_HARDWARE), this will be internally treated as FMOD_SOFTWARE. */
00874 #define FMOD_SOFTWARE                  0x00000040  /* Makes the sound be mixed by the FMOD CPU based software mixer.  Overrides FMOD_HARDWARE.  Use this for FFT, DSP, compressed sample support, 2D multi-speaker support and other software related features. */
00875 #define FMOD_CREATESTREAM              0x00000080  /* Decompress at runtime, streaming from the source provided (ie from disk).  Overrides FMOD_CREATESAMPLE and FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE.  Note a stream can only be played once at a time due to a stream only having 1 stream buffer and file handle.  Open multiple streams to have them play concurrently. */
00876 #define FMOD_CREATESAMPLE              0x00000100  /* Decompress at loadtime, decompressing or decoding whole file into memory as the target sample format (ie PCM).  Fastest for FMOD_SOFTWARE based playback and most flexible.  */
00877 #define FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE    0x00000200  /* Load MP2, MP3, IMAADPCM or XMA into memory and leave it compressed.  During playback the FMOD software mixer will decode it in realtime as a 'compressed sample'.  Can only be used in combination with FMOD_SOFTWARE.  Overrides FMOD_CREATESAMPLE.  If the sound data is not ADPCM, MPEG or XMA it will behave as if it was created with FMOD_CREATESAMPLE and decode the sound into PCM. */
00878 #define FMOD_OPENUSER                  0x00000400  /* Opens a user created static sample or stream. Use FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO to specify format and/or read callbacks.  If a user created 'sample' is created with no read callback, the sample will be empty.  Use Sound::lock and Sound::unlock to place sound data into the sound if this is the case. */
00879 #define FMOD_OPENMEMORY                0x00000800  /* "name_or_data" will be interpreted as a pointer to memory instead of filename for creating sounds.  Use FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO to specify length.  If used with FMOD_CREATESAMPLE or FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE, FMOD duplicates the memory into its own buffers.  Your own buffer can be freed after open.  If used with FMOD_CREATESTREAM, FMOD will stream out of the buffer whose pointer you passed in.  In this case, your own buffer should not be freed until you have finished with and released the stream.*/
00880 #define FMOD_OPENMEMORY_POINT          0x10000000  /* "name_or_data" will be interpreted as a pointer to memory instead of filename for creating sounds.  Use FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO to specify length.  This differs to FMOD_OPENMEMORY in that it uses the memory as is, without duplicating the memory into its own buffers.  For Wii/PSP FMOD_HARDWARE supports this flag for the GCADPCM/VAG formats.  On other platforms FMOD_SOFTWARE must be used, as sound hardware on the other platforms (ie PC) cannot access main ram.  Cannot be freed after open, only after Sound::release.   Will not work if the data is compressed and FMOD_CREATECOMPRESSEDSAMPLE is not used. */
00881 #define FMOD_OPENRAW                   0x00001000  /* Will ignore file format and treat as raw pcm.  Use FMOD_CREATESOUNDEXINFO to specify format.  Requires at least defaultfrequency, numchannels and format to be specified before it will open.  Must be little endian data. */
00882 #define FMOD_OPENONLY                  0x00002000  /* Just open the file, dont prebuffer or read.  Good for fast opens for info, or when sound::readData is to be used. */
00883 #define FMOD_ACCURATETIME              0x00004000  /* For System::createSound - for accurate Sound::getLength/Channel::setPosition on VBR MP3, and MOD/S3M/XM/IT/MIDI files.  Scans file first, so takes longer to open. FMOD_OPENONLY does not affect this. */
00884 #define FMOD_MPEGSEARCH                0x00008000  /* For corrupted / bad MP3 files.  This will search all the way through the file until it hits a valid MPEG header.  Normally only searches for 4k. */
00885 #define FMOD_NONBLOCKING               0x00010000  /* For opening sounds and getting streamed subsounds (seeking) asyncronously.  Use Sound::getOpenState to poll the state of the sound as it opens or retrieves the subsound in the background. */
00886 #define FMOD_UNIQUE                    0x00020000  /* Unique sound, can only be played one at a time */
00887 #define FMOD_3D_HEADRELATIVE           0x00040000  /* Make the sound's position, velocity and orientation relative to the listener. */
00888 #define FMOD_3D_WORLDRELATIVE          0x00080000  /* Make the sound's position, velocity and orientation absolute (relative to the world). (DEFAULT) */
00889 #define FMOD_3D_INVERSEROLLOFF         0x00100000  /* This sound will follow the inverse rolloff model where mindistance = full volume, maxdistance = where sound stops attenuating, and rolloff is fixed according to the global rolloff factor.  (DEFAULT) */
00890 #define FMOD_3D_LINEARROLLOFF          0x00200000  /* This sound will follow a linear rolloff model where mindistance = full volume, maxdistance = silence.  Rolloffscale is ignored. */
00891 #define FMOD_3D_LINEARSQUAREROLLOFF    0x00400000  /* This sound will follow a linear-square rolloff model where mindistance = full volume, maxdistance = silence.  Rolloffscale is ignored. */
00892 #define FMOD_3D_CUSTOMROLLOFF          0x04000000  /* This sound will follow a rolloff model defined by Sound::set3DCustomRolloff / Channel::set3DCustomRolloff.  */
00893 #define FMOD_3D_IGNOREGEOMETRY         0x40000000  /* Is not affect by geometry occlusion.  If not specified in Sound::setMode, or Channel::setMode, the flag is cleared and it is affected by geometry again. */
00894 #define FMOD_UNICODE                   0x01000000  /* Filename is double-byte unicode. */
00895 #define FMOD_IGNORETAGS                0x02000000  /* Skips id3v2/asf/etc tag checks when opening a sound, to reduce seek/read overhead when opening files (helps with CD performance). */
00896 #define FMOD_LOWMEM                    0x08000000  /* Removes some features from samples to give a lower memory overhead, like Sound::getName.  See remarks. */
00897 #define FMOD_LOADSECONDARYRAM          0x20000000  /* Load sound into the secondary RAM of supported platform. On PS3, sounds will be loaded into RSX/VRAM. */
00898 #define FMOD_VIRTUAL_PLAYFROMSTART     0x80000000  /* For sounds that start virtual (due to being quiet or low importance), instead of swapping back to audible, and playing at the correct offset according to time, this flag makes the sound play from the start. */
00899 
00900 /* [DEFINE_END] */
00901 
00902 
00903 /*
00904 [ENUM]
00905 [
00906     [DESCRIPTION]   
00907     These values describe what state a sound is in after FMOD_NONBLOCKING has been used to open it.
00908 
00909     [REMARKS]
00910     With streams, if you are using FMOD_NONBLOCKING, note that if the user calls Sound::getSubSound, a stream will go into FMOD_OPENSTATE_SEEKING state and sound related commands will return FMOD_ERR_NOTREADY.<br>
00911     With streams, if you are using FMOD_NONBLOCKING, note that if the user calls Channel::getPosition, a stream will go into FMOD_OPENSTATE_SETPOSITION state and sound related commands will return FMOD_ERR_NOTREADY.<br>
00912 
00913     [PLATFORMS]
00914     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00915 
00916     [SEE_ALSO]
00917     Sound::getOpenState
00918     FMOD_MODE
00919 ]
00920 */
00921 typedef enum
00922 {
00923     FMOD_OPENSTATE_READY = 0,       /* Opened and ready to play. */
00924     FMOD_OPENSTATE_LOADING,         /* Initial load in progress. */
00925     FMOD_OPENSTATE_ERROR,           /* Failed to open - file not found, out of memory etc.  See return value of Sound::getOpenState for what happened. */
00926     FMOD_OPENSTATE_CONNECTING,      /* Connecting to remote host (internet sounds only). */
00927     FMOD_OPENSTATE_BUFFERING,       /* Buffering data. */
00928     FMOD_OPENSTATE_SEEKING,         /* Seeking to subsound and re-flushing stream buffer. */
00929     FMOD_OPENSTATE_PLAYING,         /* Ready and playing, but not possible to release at this time without stalling the main thread. */
00930     FMOD_OPENSTATE_SETPOSITION,     /* Seeking within a stream to a different position. */
00931 
00932     FMOD_OPENSTATE_MAX,             /* Maximum number of open state types. */
00933     FMOD_OPENSTATE_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00934 } FMOD_OPENSTATE;
00935

00937 /*
00938 [ENUM]
00939 [
00940     [DESCRIPTION]   
00941     These flags are used with SoundGroup::setMaxAudibleBehavior to determine what happens when more sounds 
00942     are played than are specified with SoundGroup::setMaxAudible.
00943 
00944     [REMARKS]
00945     When using FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_MUTE, SoundGroup::setMuteFadeSpeed can be used to stop a sudden transition.  
00946     Instead, the time specified will be used to cross fade between the sounds that go silent and the ones that become audible.
00947 
00948     [PLATFORMS]
00949     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00950 
00951     [SEE_ALSO]      
00952     SoundGroup::setMaxAudibleBehavior
00953     SoundGroup::getMaxAudibleBehavior
00954     SoundGroup::setMaxAudible
00955     SoundGroup::getMaxAudible
00956     SoundGroup::setMuteFadeSpeed
00957     SoundGroup::getMuteFadeSpeed
00958 ]
00959 */
00960 typedef enum 
00961 {
00962     FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_FAIL,              /* Any sound played that puts the sound count over the SoundGroup::setMaxAudible setting, will simply fail during System::playSound. */
00963     FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_MUTE,              /* Any sound played that puts the sound count over the SoundGroup::setMaxAudible setting, will be silent, then if another sound in the group stops the sound that was silent before becomes audible again. */
00964     FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_STEALLOWEST,       /* Any sound played that puts the sound count over the SoundGroup::setMaxAudible setting, will steal the quietest / least important sound playing in the group. */
00965 
00966     FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_MAX,               /* Maximum number of open state types. */
00967     FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR_FORCEINT = 65536   /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00968 } FMOD_SOUNDGROUP_BEHAVIOR;

00973 [

00975     These callback types are used with Channel::setCallback.
00976 
00977     [REMARKS]
00978     Each callback has commanddata parameters passed as int unique to the type of callback.<br>
00979     See reference to FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACK to determine what they might mean for each type of callback.<br>
00980     <br>
00981     <b>Note!</b>  Currently the user must call System::update for these callbacks to trigger!
00982 
00983     [PLATFORMS]
00984     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android

00986     [SEE_ALSO]

00988     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACK
00989     System::update
00990 ]
00991 */
00992 typedef enum
00993 {
00994     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_END,                  /* Called when a sound ends. */
00995     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_VIRTUALVOICE,         /* Called when a voice is swapped out or swapped in. */
00996     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_SYNCPOINT,            /* Called when a syncpoint is encountered.  Can be from wav file markers. */
00997     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_OCCLUSION,            /* Called when the channel has its geometry occlusion value calculated.  Can be used to clamp or change the value. */
00998 
00999     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_MAX,                  /* Maximum number of callback types supported. */
01000     FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE_FORCEINT = 65536      /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */

01004 /*
01005 [ENUM]
01006 [
01007     [DESCRIPTION]   
01008     These callback types are used with System::setCallback.
01009 
01010     [REMARKS]
01011     Each callback has commanddata parameters passed as void* unique to the type of callback.<br>
01012     See reference to FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACK to determine what they might mean for each type of callback.<br>
01013     <br>
01014     <b>Note!</b> Using FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_DEVICELISTCHANGED (on Mac only) requires the application to be running an event loop which will allow external changes to device list to be detected by FMOD.
01015     <br>
01016     <b>Note!</b> The 'system' object pointer will be null for FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_THREADCREATED and FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_MEMORYALLOCATIONFAILED callbacks.
01017 
01018     [PLATFORMS]
01019     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
01020 
01021     [SEE_ALSO]      
01022     System::setCallback
01023     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACK
01024     System::update
01025     DSP::addInput
01026 ]
01027 */
01028 typedef enum
01029 {
01030     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_DEVICELISTCHANGED,         /* Called from System::update when the enumerated list of devices has changed. */
01031     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_DEVICELOST,                /* Called from System::update when an output device has been lost due to control panel parameter changes and FMOD cannot automatically recover. */
01032     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_MEMORYALLOCATIONFAILED,    /* Called directly when a memory allocation fails somewhere in FMOD.  (NOTE - 'system' will be NULL in this callback type.)*/
01033     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_THREADCREATED,             /* Called directly when a thread is created. (NOTE - 'system' will be NULL in this callback type.) */
01034     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_BADDSPCONNECTION,          /* Called when a bad connection was made with DSP::addInput. Usually called from mixer thread because that is where the connections are made.  */
01035     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_BADDSPLEVEL,               /* Called when too many effects were added exceeding the maximum tree depth of 128.  This is most likely caused by accidentally adding too many DSP effects. Usually called from mixer thread because that is where the connections are made.  */
01036 
01037     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_MAX,                       /* Maximum number of callback types supported. */
01038     FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE_FORCEINT = 65536           /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
01039 } FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE;

01045 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACK)       (FMOD_SYSTEM *system, FMOD_SYSTEM_CALLBACKTYPE type, void *commanddata1, void *commanddata2);
01046 
01047 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACK)      (FMOD_CHANNEL *channel, FMOD_CHANNEL_CALLBACKTYPE type, void *commanddata1, void *commanddata2);
01048

01050 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_SOUND_PCMREADCALLBACK)(FMOD_SOUND *sound, void *data, unsigned int datalen);
01051 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_SOUND_PCMSETPOSCALLBACK)(FMOD_SOUND *sound, int subsound, unsigned int position, FMOD_TIMEUNIT postype);
01052 
01053 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_FILE_OPENCALLBACK)     (const char *name, int unicode, unsigned int *filesize, void **handle, void **userdata);
01054 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_FILE_CLOSECALLBACK)    (void *handle, void *userdata);
01055 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_FILE_READCALLBACK)     (void *handle, void *buffer, unsigned int sizebytes, unsigned int *bytesread, void *userdata);
01056 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_FILE_SEEKCALLBACK)     (void *handle, unsigned int pos, void *userdata);

01061 typedef void *      (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_MEMORY_REALLOCCALLBACK)(void *ptr, unsigned int size, FMOD_MEMORY_TYPE type, const char *sourcestr);

01065 
01066 
01067 /*
01068 [ENUM]
01069 [
01070     [DESCRIPTION]   
01071     List of windowing methods used in spectrum analysis to reduce leakage / transient signals intefering with the analysis.<br>
01072     This is a problem with analysis of continuous signals that only have a small portion of the signal sample (the fft window size).<br>
01073     Windowing the signal with a curve or triangle tapers the sides of the fft window to help alleviate this problem.
01074 
01075     [REMARKS]
01076     Cyclic signals such as a sine wave that repeat their cycle in a multiple of the window size do not need windowing.<br>
01077     I.e. If the sine wave repeats every 1024, 512, 256 etc samples and the FMOD fft window is 1024, then the signal would not need windowing.<br>
01078     Not windowing is the same as FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_RECT, which is the default.<br>
01079     If the cycle of the signal (ie the sine wave) is not a multiple of the window size, it will cause frequency abnormalities, so a different windowing method is needed.<br>
01080     <exclude>
01081     <br>
01082     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_RECT.<br>
01083     <img src="..\static\rectangle.gif"></img><br>
01084     <br>
01085     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_TRIANGLE.<br>
01086     <img src="..\static\triangle.gif"></img><br>
01087     <br>
01088     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_HAMMING.<br>
01089     <img src="..\static\hamming.gif"></img><br>
01090     <br>
01091     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_HANNING.<br>
01092     <img src="..\static\hanning.gif"></img><br>
01093     <br>
01094     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_BLACKMAN.<br>
01095     <img src="..\static\blackman.gif"></img><br>
01096     <br>
01097     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_BLACKMANHARRIS.<br>
01098     <img src="..\static\blackmanharris.gif"></img>
01099     </exclude>
01100     
01101     [PLATFORMS]
01102     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
01103 
01104     [SEE_ALSO]      
01105     System::getSpectrum
01106     Channel::getSpectrum
01107 ]
01108 */
01109 typedef enum
01110 {
01111     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_RECT,            /* w[n] = 1.0                                                                                            */
01112     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_TRIANGLE,        /* w[n] = TRI(2n/N)                                                                                      */
01113     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_HAMMING,         /* w[n] = 0.54 - (0.46 * COS(n/N) )                                                                      */
01114     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_HANNING,         /* w[n] = 0.5 *  (1.0  - COS(n/N) )                                                                      */
01115     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_BLACKMAN,        /* w[n] = 0.42 - (0.5  * COS(n/N) ) + (0.08 * COS(2.0 * n/N) )                                           */
01116     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_BLACKMANHARRIS,  /* w[n] = 0.35875 - (0.48829 * COS(1.0 * n/N)) + (0.14128 * COS(2.0 * n/N)) - (0.01168 * COS(3.0 * n/N)) */
01117     
01118     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_MAX,             /* Maximum number of FFT window types supported. */
01119     FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
01120 } FMOD_DSP_FFT_WINDOW;
01121 
01122 
01123 /*
01124 [ENUM]
01125 [
01126     [DESCRIPTION]   
01127     List of interpolation types that the FMOD Ex software mixer supports.  
01128 
01129     [REMARKS]
01130     The default resampler type is FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_LINEAR.<br>
01131     Use System::setSoftwareFormat to tell FMOD the resampling quality you require for FMOD_SOFTWARE based sounds.
01132 
01133     [PLATFORMS]
01134     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
01135 
01136     [SEE_ALSO]      
01137     System::setSoftwareFormat
01138     System::getSoftwareFormat
01139 ]
01140 */
01141 typedef enum
01142 {
01143     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_NOINTERP,        /* No interpolation.  High frequency aliasing hiss will be audible depending on the sample rate of the sound. */
01144     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_LINEAR,          /* Linear interpolation (default method).  Fast and good quality, causes very slight lowpass effect on low frequency sounds. */
01145     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_CUBIC,           /* Cubic interpolation.  Slower than linear interpolation but better quality. */
01146     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_SPLINE,          /* 5 point spline interpolation.  Slowest resampling method but best quality. */
01147 
01148     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_MAX,             /* Maximum number of resample methods supported. */
01149     FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER_FORCEINT = 65536 /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
01150 } FMOD_DSP_RESAMPLER;
01151 
01152

01158

01181
